attributes.action: limit new-build house price per 100 square metres to 5 times average local salary
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It would be illegal to sell a house built in 2010 or beyond for more than 5 times the average local salary per 100 square metres.

For example, if average local salary was £25000, then it would be illegal to sell a 50 square metre house built in 2010 or beyond for more than £62500.

Average local salary would be published by the government on a town or county basis at the start of each year.

This law would encourage innovation in the building industry and ensure a good supply of genuinely affordable housing.
